good_buy_bullets: <s>Many consumers liked the eye-catching aesthetics of the Asics Gel Foundation 13.</s><s>Those who had problems with the muscles and tendons of the feet and legs claimed that this running shoe was able to stave off pain and gait deviations.</s><s>The cushioning system was lauded because it apparently provided tons of underfoot support.</s><s>People liked that the insole can be removed, and that custom orthotics can easily be placed on the platform.</s><s>Some purchasers stated that this product worked well as a work-shoe or as a part of casual apparel.</s>

good_buy_bullets: <s>The Asics Gel FujiTrabuco 7 performed excellently on wet surfaces, according to several users. good_buy_bullets: <s>According to the majority, the North Face Ultra 109 GTX is a pair of highly comfortable shoes.</s><s>Several runners mentioned that the shoe provided the needed level of protection underfoot to run over rocks and similar risky terrains.</s><s>Many users lauded the enhanced breathability of the shoe which kept both the user’s feet and the shoe dry throughout the running sessions.</s><s>Some users were of the opinion that the footwear had a rugged build.</s><s>A few customers appreciated the traction of the footwear over tricky slopes and rocky trails.</s><s>A number of users agreed that the shoe runs true-to-size.</s><s>The Ultra 109 GTX is an affordable waterproof running shoe.</s>

good_buy_bullets: <s>A good number of runners have used the Adidas Energy Cloud for gym workouts.</s><s>It is super affordable.</s><s>It is quite light.</s><s>Several users appreciated the comfortable fit of this shoe.</s><s>The numerous holes offer great breathability.</s><s>A midfoot cage that extends to form an external heel counter lock down the foot.</s><s>The Adiwear outsole provides excellent durability.</s><s>Several runners valued the shoe’s noticeable responsiveness.</s><s>There are numerous color options available.</s><s>It is great for all-day standing or for work, according to a good number of reviewers.</s><s>The shoe can really take a beating before it begins to show wear and tear, as reported by more than a few users.</s>

bad_buy_bullets: <s>The Nike Air Max 2016 looked awkwardly bulky for several testers, and they wrote that the bulky look didn’t make it visually endearing.</s><s>Some runners reported that the Air Max unit of this shoe burst, rendering the mid-sole unit virtually unusable.</s>

good_buy_bullets: <s>Several runners commented that wearing the On Cloudsurfer was like running in socks, but with loads of cushioning.</s><s>A runner commented that they weren’t able to feel any pressure on their ankles or knees while using this shoe for long running sessions.</s><s>Some purchasers noted that they were able to run faster and longer with this shoe.</s><s>There were testers who noticed a springy sensation with every step and they wrote that it allowed them to be more efficient when performing.</s><s>According to many users, this shoe was able to deliver a soft ride and a secure fit.</s><s>A consumer commended the responsiveness of this shoe; they felt like running on air with it.</s><s>A number of testers stated that its cushioning systems were efficient when it came to preventing discomfort or injury during the running session.</s><s>There were runners who felt that the On Cloudsurfer didn’t need a break-in period, that it was comfortable from the get-go.</s><s>The upper unit felt like a ‘natural coating’ for the foot, wrote a consumer; they didn’t experience blisters or irritation because of it.</s>

good_buy_bullets: <s>Many users are amazed at the arch support provided by the shoe.</s><s>One reviewer said it worked great as a stability shoe for their overpronation.</s><s>Several runners found the SpeedForm Europa to be durable and able to withstand long-distance running.</s><s>Some commenters mentioned the shoe performed well under different road surfaces.</s><s>The cushioning was impressive and delivered both comfort and stability beyond expectation, as written by a reviewer.</s>

bottom_line: The Asics GT 3000 5 is one of the best trainers for those with late-stage overpronation. It features sufficient support and comfortable cushioning without slowing the runner down. good_buy_bullets: <s>Some testers mentioned that the shoe if very light and fast.</s><s>The shoe provides right amount of support and cushioning.</s><s>Many runners were amazed by the durability of the shoe.</s><s>Considering the performance of the shoe, the price is really reasonable.</s><s>Available in different color options.</s>
bad_buy_bullets: <s>The shoe is too narrow for some runners.</s><s>Some noticed that the shoe is not comfortable enough for running.</s>
bottom_line: The Skechers GOrun 3 is a road running shoe designed for neutral foot movement. It is made with a great combination of support, comfort and protection. As a fast and light shoe, it is best for daily running and long runs.

shoeName: New Balance Fresh Foam Zante v3 Breathe
good_buy_bullets: <s>Many runners appreciated the lightweight disposition of the New Balance Fresh Foam Zante v3 Breathe.</s><s>The breathable nature of the upper unit gained positive feedback from those who have tested it.</s><s>Some consumers stated that this running shoe was versatile enough to function well in various activities such as casual walks and workout sessions.</s><s>The price was considered to be affordable by most purchasers.</s><s>People liked the variety of color options.</s><s>‘Comfortable’ was a term that was frequently used to describe this running shoe.</s>
bad_buy_bullets: <s>A few consumers felt that it was half-a-size smaller than their expectations.</s>
bottom_line: The New Balance Fresh Foam Zante v3 Breathe was able to capture the attention of many runners. It was appreciated for being lightweight, comfortable and versatile. Even the price and color options were something to enjoy. Suffice it to say that this neutral running shoe has been considered as a reliable companion for the roads.

good_buy_bullets: <s>The underfoot cushioning system seemed to help in achieving a smooth and natural stride, based on several reviews.</s><s>More than a handful of people liked the sturdy build of the New Balance 880 v8 GTX, stating that the materials lasted long.</s><s>The fact that wide variations of this shoe’s width are available was appreciated by many testers.</s><s>A break-in period wasn’t necessary for this running shoe, some individuals claimed; this shoe was apparently comfortable right out of the box.</s><s>According to several runners, the 880 v8 GTX had a weight that was lighter than they expected.</s>
bad_buy_bullets: <s>A few consumers lamented the lack of a narrow-width variant; they felt that the standard width option of this model was a bit wide.</s><s>A couple of runners felt that the limited breathability of the upper caused the foot to feel a bit warm and sweaty.</s>
bottom_line: The feedback for the New Balance 880 v8 GTX was very positive. Most were glad of its capacity to lead the foot smoothly through the gait cycle. People were also happy with its durable build, multiple width options, and lightweight disposition. On the other hand, this road companion received criticism for having a stuff interior and for skimping on a narrow-width option.

good_buy_bullets: <s>Many runners have noted that the Strata 3 feels light and gently molds to the contours of their feet, ensuring a comfortable ride.</s><s>Some users were happy on how well the shoe performed on a variety of terrains and provided a smooth ride.</s><s>A number of wearers deemed the Strata 3 to be sturdy yet feel light, which is a good assurance for a running shoe that is aimed at high mileage runners.</s><s>Most users liked the shoe's toe box as it is spacious enough to allow the feet to splay naturally during the runs.</s><s>A few testers mentioned how the shoe’s lacing system was both comfortable and secure.</s>
bad_buy_bullets: <s>A handful of wearers have disliked that the Strata 3’s tongue felt a little flimsy.</s><s>One runner has said that under race conditions, the shoe felt a bit too clunky for his liking.</s>
bottom_line: Overall, the improvement seen in the 361 Degrees Strata 3 has impressed most of its users.  The shoe fits well and performed great on different types of terrains, even providing a smooth ride along the way.  Despite concerns about the shoe’s tongue and bulkiness, most runners are still pleased with its performance in general proving that the Strata 3 is a reliable road running shoe offering just the right amount of stability.

good_buy_bullets: <s>A handful of wearers noted that the shoe was lightweight.</s><s>Some testers mentioned that the shoe was comfortable.</s><s>Many buyers commented that the Saucony Kineta Relay Reflex was stylish.</s><s>A lot of purchasers appreciated its snug fit.</s><s>According to those who have tried it, the Saucony Kineta Relay Reflex has excellent quality.</s><s>The shoe was not only best for running activities but also for workout sessions, based on some reviews.</s><s>Several runners loved wearing the shoe on casual occasions.</s>
bad_buy_bullets: <s>Several testers commented that the sole was not durable. It easily torn apart after several uses only.</s><s>One of the users said that the toe box was narrow.</s>
bottom_line: A handful of purchasers agreed that the Saucony Kineta Relay Reflex was a comfortable and lightweight running shoe. They were amazed by its stylish design. They were happy wearing the shoe not only in running activities but also in training sessions. Although several of them commented that it has a narrow toe box, others still lauded the shoe because of its snug fit. In general, the majority of the purchasers recommended the Saucony Kineta Relay Reflex for those who are looking for a running shoe that will surely provide an incredible performance and quality.

good_buy_bullets: <s>Many reviewers raved about the shoe’s low profile for maximum mobility.</s><s>The Z Fury Tempo is very flexible.</s><s>Comfort is at the top of its list of qualities, as far as most runners are concerned.</s><s>Many testers consider this as a great beginner’s running shoe.</s><s>Some call it a hybrid shoe that delivers well on race day and durable enough for daily training.</s><s>Several runners appreciated its ample cushioning and responsive features.</s>
bad_buy_bullets: <s>A handful of runners disliked the way the outsole attracts small rocks and other road debris.</s><s>Others noted that it wasn’t able to provide a robust cushioning system to fully carry the foot responsibly.</s>
bottom_line: The Reebok Z Fury Tempo is a no-nonsense shoe that delivers great service and performance. With good enough arch support, excellent flexibility, and unbelievable comfort, runners can get the most value out of a shoe that is quite inexpensive in the first place.

good_buy_bullets: <s>The underfoot cushioning system of the Under Armour Threadborne Reveal worked exceptionally well, according to most of those who have tested it.</s><s>Many consumers noted that the available sizes adhered to their expectations.</s><s>A lot of people liked the looks of this running shoe.</s><s>The upper offered a snug and secure fit, several runners commented.</s>
bad_buy_bullets: <s>A tester complained that the back portion of the upper caused rubbing and bleeding.</s><s>The lace-loops on the midfoot panels have broken off after only a few uses, according to a purchaser.</s><s>Several consumers noted that the fit across the midfoot and heel areas was too tight.</s><s>Some runners had a difficult time putting on this shoe, stating that it was difficult to slide the foot in the foot-chamber.</s><s>The fabric of the upper unit wasn’t very stretchy, a tester noted; he felt that it restricted natural movement.</s>
bottom_line: The response for the Under Armour Threadborne Reveal was mixed. People were happy with this neutral shoe’s design and its comfortable underfoot experience. Conversely, many were partial to its apparently restrictive upper, its questionable durability and its inconsistent fit. It’s a divisive companion for the roads, one that straddles between efficacy and tedium.

good_buy_bullets: <s>The upper unit’s so-sew mesh and synthetic application makes for a comfortable and durable coverage.</s><s>Runners appreciated that the overlay system has been directly applied onto the upper unit, making it one with the fabric.</s><s>A good number of testers noted that the different color schemes available for this model made it more visually appealing.</s><s>The mid-sole unit is comprised of a variety of cushioning systems that provide sure underfoot support and comfort for a variety of activities.</s><s>The New Balance 775 v2 has a budget-friendly price.</s><s>A smooth fabric lines the inner sleeve of this model, keeping the foot comfortable even when wearing it without socks.</s>
bad_buy_bullets: <s>There were runners who thought that the tongue and collar didn’t have enough padding to help keep their feet locked in place.</s><s>The thin rubber on the outsole wore out quickly for some testers.</s><s>A few testers noted that it was half-a-size smaller than the usual.</s>
bottom_line: The 2nd version of the 775 from New Balance offers a more robust cushioning system, an appealing upper design and an overall comfortable running experience. Flexibility and responsiveness are its strengths. It’s a solid option for daily running and training.

good_buy_bullets: <s>Users appreciated the minimalist design of the shoe since they could be passed off as a casual sneaker.</s><s>Plenty of users described the shoe as comfortable.</s><s>Several users acknowledged the light weight of the shoe.</s><s>A majority of testers commented that the shoe worked great in the gym or when used as an attire for walking.</s><s>Plenty of users admired the shoe for its quality construction.</s><s>The price for a pair of the Puma Flare Mesh is affordable, commented several purchasers.</s>
bad_buy_bullets: <s>A number of male testers described the shoe as smaller than expected.</s><s>Several male reviewers found that it was a bit narrow.</s><s>A few reviewers noticed that the tread on the shoe wore out easily.</s><s>Various users concluded that the shoe was not ideal for running because, to them, it offered little support.</s><s>Several female testers observed that the shoe was slightly wide.</s><s>One user commented that he felt a slight pain in his ankle while he was wearing the shoe.</s>
bottom_line: A neutral road running shoe that doubles as a casual yet stylish sneaker – this is the Puma Flare Mesh. Runners are going to enjoy the comfort it provides as well as appreciate the price the shoe comes in. It may not be as reliable when used for serious running, but its light weight, current look and reasonable price point makes it a considerable option for daily wear.
